title.narrative: 5.3 PROGRAME MANAGEMENT & COORDINATION

description.narrative: Throughout 2013 â€“ 2017, UNICEF and OPII programme management and coordination teams receive technical support in research, analysis, evaluation, planning, quality assurance, risk mitigation, monitoring, and reporting., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: High quality research and evaluation provides evidence to influence policies, budgets, programmes and programme adjustments, in favour of the most disadvantaged children and women in Pakistan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Throughout 2013 ? 2017, UNICEF and OPII programme management and coordination teams receive technical support in research, analysis, evaluation, planning, quality assurance, risk mitigation, monitoring, and reporting.

description.narrative: Technical and coordination support in line with the RBM principles strengthened the results focus of UNICEF&39;s programme management for the current and new country programme cycle, both internally and under OPII. Effective contribution management, enhanced resource mobilization coupled with strengthened field monitoring and reporting mechanisms enhanced accountability and transparency. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: % COARs produced, uploaded on CO portal (internal version) and published (external version)
